```{r}
# GENRES CLEANING CODE 
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
tmdb <- read.csv("/Users/louislimnavong/Desktop/homework/tmdb.csv",stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
tmdb <- tmdb %>% mutate(genres = gsub('"name"', "", genres))
tmdb <- tmdb %>% mutate(genres = gsub('"id"', "", genres))
tmdb <- tmdb %>% mutate(genres = chartr('}"][}{:1234567890', '                 ', genres))
tmdb <- tmdb %>% mutate(genres = gsub(" ", "", genres))
tmdb <- tmdb %>% separate(genres,into = c("null", "1", "null1", "2", "null2", "3", "null3","4","null4", "5", "null5", "6"),sep = ',' ,remove = TRUE)
movies <- tmdb[c(1,3,5,7,9,11,13,18)]
View(movies)
```

```{r}
# SCORE BETWEEN TWO MOVIES FOR THE GENRES
matrix_movies <- as.matrix(movies)
f <- function(names) {
  i <- which(movies$original_title == names[1])
  j <- which(movies$original_title == names[2])
  vector_movies <- intersect(matrix_movies[i,],matrix_movies[j,])
  vector_movies <- vector_movies[!is.na(vector_movies)]
  length(vector_movies)
}
f(c("Avengers: Age of Ultron","Men in Black 3"))
```
